result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lester Jones Whitmore

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lester Jones Whitmore in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Lester Jones Whitmore.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held.  Atty. Flynn has not received an offer and would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Lester Jones Whitmore appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Lester Jones Whitmore.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned for in-person status conference, Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lester Jones Whitmore in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel was recentely appointed and has received discovery.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with MLC.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 7/29/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Lester Jones Whitmore in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/27/22 @ 1:30p
